content: kindle sleeve by devan sessions aka warm your buns this pattern is not allowed to be redistributed resold or shared all rights reserved any items handmade by you from this pattern may be sold please credit me warm your buns as the designer i would love to see your makes share with me on social media @warmyourbuns skills required basic knowledge of crochet basic sewing skills project materials yarn worsted weight 55g i used red heart super saver 5 00 mm hook stitch markers 20mm button tapestry needle scissors stitch abbreviations chain- chain slip_stitch- slip_stitch single_crochet- single_crochet double_crochet- double_crochet fpdc- front post double_crochet st- stitch fo- finish off project notes final dimensions ~7 25in x 5 25in if you need help follow along with the this project is written in us terminology youtube video you will be using the alpine stitch this stitch is made by alternating double_crochet and fpdc you will be joining at the end of each round *chain 2 at the beginning of each round does not count as a double_crochet this sleeve will fit a kindle paperwhite the one pictured is a 11th gen this pattern is not allowed to be redistributed resold or shared all rights reserved any items handmade by you from this pattern may be sold please credit me warm your buns as the designer i would love to see your makes share with me on social media @warmyourbuns pattern chain 22 1 double_crochet in the 3rd chain from your hook 18 double_crochet 2 double_crochet in the last chain now we will be working along the other side of the chain see picture below 19 double_crochet slip_stitch to the first double_crochet 40 double_crochet bottom side of the chain previously worked double_crochet 2 chain 2* double_crochet fpdc alternate between double_crochet and fpdc all the way around slip_stitch 40 double_crochet 3 chain 2* fpdc double_crochet alternate between fpdc and double_crochet all the way around slip_stitch 40dc this is the alpine stitch 4-19 repeat row 2 & 3 slip_stitch fo this pattern is not allowed to be redistributed resold or shared all rights reserved any items handmade by you from this pattern may be sold please credit me warm your buns as the designer i would love to see your makes share with me on social media @warmyourbuns 20 find the middle 6 stitches and reconnect your yarn single_crochet 6 21-26 chain 1 turn single_crochet 6 27 chain 1 turn single_crochet 2 chain 2 skip the next two stitches this will be your button hole single_crochet 2 28 chain 1 turn single_crochet 2 2 single_crochet around the chain 2 single_crochet 2 29 chain 1 turn single_crochet 6 fo button count 4 row down from the top this is where you ll be attaching the button sew on your button and voila you are done this pattern is not allowed to be redistributed resold or shared all rights reserved any items handmade by you from this pattern may be sold please credit me warm your buns as
